reviews.title: Reliable Hardware Delivered to My Front Door 1Hr
reviews.review_text: I have several WD Externals of various ages, they seem to last a good long time. Not sure if I have had an external fail yet. Works great especially if you have good USB 3.0 or 3.2 ports that can keep up with it and take full advantage of its high speed interface. I have a lot of machines for the work that I do and needed something fast and reliable to transfer a lot of files, store them, and then quickly return them to the server when it was ready after a recent equipment failure. Being able to order one up quickly on Walmart.com and have it brought to my home office in an hour is amazingly convenient and helpful. Where else can you get a 4TB external USB 3.0 HDD at 7:30 at night? Thank you.
My only complaint was the cost a year ago. this item cost half again as much as it does now otherwise it's easy to set up. looks to be quite dependable as most most Western digital items are

reviews.title: Great external Hard drive
reviews.review_text: I have used WD My Books for over 12 years. Most important when storing files, you want them to be RELIABLE. These are. I've tried Seagate and others as well. Always come back to W. D.

reviews.title: Great/Perfect Media Storage at a fair price.
reviews.review_text: I am very pleased with my 4TB hard drive. I had worked as a private school teacher for about twenty years, so I had accumulated a great deal of educational materials along the way - including audio courses, an extensive Ebook library, and obviously video and music. The 4TB disk is my storage library - allowing me to retrieve and/or share materials with others at lightning speed - while leaving my 1TB hard disk freed for routine, daily business. I highly recommend this product. And when it fills, buy another and lay it alongside. But most folks would probably not need more than 4TB to store their media.

reviews.title: DECADES OF RELIABLE HARD DRIVES
reviews.review_text: We started using Western products for business in the late 1980's and had very few quality issues. Later in retirement we continued to use Western external hard drives as backup to our computer drives. In the last decade we began using the external hard drive for all things and no longer relied on the computer hard drive to backup of personal files. We have had only one Western drive unexplained failure some years ago so starting backing up on two or more drives. We still have that drive and when testes after sitting for more than five years it starting operating as if nothing was wrong. Unfortunately it did not last and when shut down would never boot up again. So we still trust in their product after many decades. However we also suggest you backup the backup.

reviews.title: Defective, replacement defective too
reviews.review_text: Western Digital My Book 12TB external drive would not display in Windows 10 file manager. Ran Western Digital diagnostics and got "SMART status failure". Return unit and purchased another which came with box previously opened. This one did at least have a driver loaded, but still would not display and got "SMART status failure" when running WD diagnostics. I own another WD 12TB drive that has worked fine for years.

reviews.title: Run from this!
reviews.review_text: Run from this. Regrettably, I bought this one and another 16tb drive because I have the WD Pro and they worked fine. Needed an external usb and bought this brand for the 16tb and 12tb. It has been less than a year and both began making the dreaded click of death!!!! Neither have been replaced yet even though still under warranty. I will never buy WD drives again including the WD Pro (-seriously how would you feel)?

When I got home I noticed the box had already been opened(the seals were broken). I still hooked it to my computer but the hard drive was bad, it was pretty obvious because of the loud ticking noise coming from the disc drive inside enclosure. I had to return to store with hard drive, apparently exchanges are not a thing any more and had to go threw this huge ordeal.

reviews.title: Arrived on time as ordered.
reviews.review_text: Arrived not working. States "fatal hardware error", after troubleshooting the hard drive is bad. All connections, the cables etc are good and the computer based on trying multiple ports.

reviews.title: selling 3 year old computer equipment as new
reviews.review_text: When I registered the product with Western Digital, they told me this device was made in Mar 1 2022. My purchase was Mar 15, 2025. They wont honor any warranty until Walmart can prove I was sold a new device and not a used/refurb devise. What a crooked way to do business by selling 3 year old Computer Devices as new. Ever heard of Moores Law? Did you know the generation cycle is normally about 6 months? That would make this drive a Great Great Grandfather. You have shattered my belief and trust I've had in quality of items I get from Walmart

reviews.title: Good External Drive
reviews.review_text: A large capacity external drive at a reasonable price. I purchased this drive as a second Time Machine backup drive for a Mac Studio Desktop computer. It is not as fast as my primary Thunderbolt drive pro, but I was surprised how much faster it was than my former usb 3 drives were. The power connection is inconsistent with some jiggline of the power plug into the drive, but I can get it to work. And the reasonable price of the refurbished drive is worth the slight power inconvenience.

reviews.title: Incompatible with WD Smartware!!!!!
reviews.review_text: I was not informed by sales literature or WD website that this drive (part of the new series of drives) is not compatible with WD Smartware Backup software until I looked very deep into their website.. The replacement software (My Backup) will not install on any of my 5 computer systems. It sucks.

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.review_text: This USB hard drive is by far the worst one I've ever earned. Every time you try to open a file or you try to save a file it "thinks" for a very long time. It takes so much time to open or close file or just navigating through the folders.

reviews.title: Could not be Happier with this purchase!!
reviews.review_text: Easy to use and is fast well fast for me anyways have no problem with a big file to transfer to this HD. I do lots of music transfers and this unit is great for me..

reviews.title: Reliable & Fast.
reviews.review_text: The My Book storage solution has always been a good investment for me. I've been using WD My Book for a long time, and have not had any problems with any of them.

reviews.title: Short life. Won't buy WD again.
reviews.review_text: Hard drive was great while it worked. Failed a little over a year in. I have multiple hard drives that are pushing 10 years of age. It's a rare occurence for me to have one fail, much less so soon. I won't be purchasing this brand again.

reviews.title: Fantastic product
reviews.review_text: I am using this as an external hard drive for my PS5. I have a couple hundred games saved on this. The PS4 games run perfectly fine playing off this drive without having to move the game back to the internal drice. I recommend this product.
so far it hasnt failed me yet connected to my ps4 pro so i can have all my ps4 games on my ps5 pro. ive ben transfering sense i got it 5 days ago strait no issues so far.

would have gotten a better review but the cord that connect the hdd to whatever you are using it with was messed up when i got it and they wouldnt replace it somi.had to buy another one. was only 11 bucks but still....not the point.

Definitely a serviceable ssd. if you need more space like i do, this isnt a bad option. I have had mine for 7 or 8 months now and it works as expected. althought the actual size is around 3.6 terabytes due to software space.

reviews.title: data is inaccessible after one week
reviews.review_text: never set a password but remains locked. Multiple people have the issue and no fix and data is encrypted. If you don't intend on setting a password, don't buy this.
Apps would not get installed on windows 10 PC. Upon connecting it to PC, it would not start and PC froze. I returned it the next day. It seems that the hard drive was damaged.

reviews.title: WD My Book external HDD
reviews.review_text: The WD My Book external HDD was new/old in the original sealed box. The S/N which is WX72D415388A has a "Ship date" of 11-21-2021, meaning Out-of-Warranty, although new, in the original faded box. I learned this date by calling WD Technical Support. They would not allow me to register the product without an invoice and taking a picture of the sticker on the HDD's bottom.

reviews.title: So Far So Good
reviews.review_text: I have had a ton of WD drives on both Windows and Mac machines, and, for the most part, they have been great. Too early to tell how this WD 18TB My Book will fair. Recently, I had a 10TB drive fail in a MyBook Duo. Did not last near as long as previous drives. Did not replace the drive. Bought an enclosure for the 2nd drive and using it as a single now. Using the MyBook Duo enclosure as a way to route USB cables. :)

reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Time
reviews.review_text: When connected to any USB port on front or back of Windows desktop computer, device was recognized by computer, but not by explorer, and therefore it could not be initialized. WIndows reported that most current driver was installed, and that device was working properly. This definitely was not true. I wasted an entire day troubleshooting this item.

reviews.title: always get the next size up
reviews.review_text: this drive is perfection but next time I will order a larger Drive

reviews.title: Good So Far
reviews.review_text: Its been a month, not the fastest hard drive but the space and reliability is worth the price

reviews.title: A great external device that's easy to use videos
reviews.review_text: This works great with downloading videos, and easy to hook up

reviews.title: 14tb My Book
reviews.review_text: Ok so far?? Time will tell?? Very sad that Western Digital thinks it is unnecessary for a power/active blue LED Light like in the older harddrive??? Don't know it is functioning unless you access from "My PC"?? My old 640Gb had worked great for 18 years. Usb cord is very short?? 3 foot?? How cheap! At least a 6 foot would be acceptable?? Cant even place My Book on desktop?? Won't reach pc tower under desk!! Why??

reviews.title: poor quality, bad experience, returned
reviews.review_text: the software (.exe file) shipped on drive did not load. The downloaded version had issues. Once I got software up and run the drive made a "clunking" noise every 4 to 5 secs and this was at idle not read or write. Called CS they said this was not normal and to return.

reviews.title: I love it - It's the fourth one I have.
reviews.review_text: It's sexy on my desk. Reliable, I've never had an issue with anything from WD, and specifically this particular model. My desk and tech are all black, with the charcoal look of my Mac. And it all looks great. I have four of them, as I use one up I buy another to back up the essentials. Each time I buy one it's larger storage and it's great. They stopped supporting an app that came supported on the three I had before this one. It allowed you to change the password and customize how it unlocks when used on your Mac, so that sucks. But the drive itself is fantastic and reliable. Western Digital seems to never disappoint at least not yet.
WD 4tb My Book is best value for what you receive. 4tbs for 100 bucks. The best purchase I've ever made at Walmart.

reviews.title: Do not buy. Failed within a week.
reviews.review_text: The drive began failing within a week. Not recognized by any system unless forced to mount, endlessly clicking the hours to its demise.

reviews.title: Data is secure now
reviews.review_text: Greae storage device.provides enormous security in regards to data protectin and recovery. Wish I had it sooner.

reviews.title: Great value and portability for off site backup
reviews.review_text: Excellent value for off site backup. Can be formatted NTFS or HFS / APFS. Formatted exFAT out of the box.

reviews.title: Make sure it has the correct TB's
reviews.review_text: When I plugged it in, it only had 10TB's, rather than the 12TB's I ordered %26 per the box label. I had to return it.
It is a great external HD for the price. you can't really beat it. However, its louder than I expected when it is running.

reviews.title: DOA
reviews.review_text: DOA. Brand spankin new. The computer would see it but when I tried to initialize it it would say fatal hardware error.

reviews.title: Trustworthy external hard drive
reviews.review_text: This is an excellent external hard drive. It is very dependable and I have owned several of these over the years. It is very important to back up your data and to trust your backup. This 4TB WD My Book is very trustworthy.
Hooked this up to my dish Wally. Formatted without issue, is small enough to fit in my cabinet and gives me a ton of HD storage. Would certainly recommend it.
I have not yet been able to see it under constant usage and I am not sure what will happen when I do. The product loos good, and installed without problem.

reviews.title: Reliable HDD - get's the job done 'by the Book'
reviews.review_text: Bought a second WD 16TB My Book for my new Mac mini 2024 computer. The first one's still running on my iMac 2017. Easy to use, setup, and run diagnostics

reviews.title: Really Efficient , Great Price %26 Unexpected Ft.
reviews.review_text: Decently Priced And Perfect Size , Runs really well , also is Energy saving too , if you don't use it for a while in between data backup it goes into a sort of standby mode which was a feature I wasn't expecting but it's Awesome to have!!

reviews.title: 12TB - holds everything
reviews.review_text: great product - condensing all my externals to this one -- still uses bearings but since it is a backup and not running all the time, acceptable for value.

reviews.title: Glad I went with refurb. Good as new!
reviews.review_text: Works perfectly! No issues at all. Easily transfers media and runs Plex server.
WD is a good quality product and have always worked well for me.
This manufacturer has a great reputation for quality and reliability.

reviews.title: What a shame
reviews.review_text: Not sure How this happened but, i bought this hard drive for school and for future work. It didn't work at all. My mac could not find it and my windows was able to find it but the hard drive was corrupted. Could not use it at all.

reviews.title: NEVER RECIEVED THE ITEM, SENT TO THE WRONG HOUSE.
reviews.review_text: My reason for giving this item a poor rating is because I never received it during that following date whomever delivered it brought it to the wrong house, the only good thing came out of all of this is I contacted customer service, hopefully things will get better.

reviews.title: After 1 month, an error occurred
reviews.review_text: Installing and formatting was pretty automatic. Starting backups was easy and went well for the first 28 days. Then it stopped backing up and the message was "an error occurred". After running Disk Utility First Aid, it is now running the first back up since the repair, and all seems to be going well. I hope this doesn't happen every month or so.

reviews.title: 12TB is Huge But Spinning Drive Is Loud
reviews.review_text: This is a great drive if you don't mind a lot of noise and vibration, or if you can keep it far away from your desk. It turned out to be unusable for me, it vibrated my whole desk all day and was quite noisy. I've been spoiled by a completely silent computer since Apple Silicon, I guess I can't use spinning drives any more.

reviews.title: WD 18TB My Book Desktop - Very Noisy
reviews.review_text: Have had good experiences with WD products in the past. This one is very noisy and constantly making a clicking noise which is very distracting. Not sure if this is normal. I'm concerned that the unit is not functioning properly and will eventually fail when it is out of warranty. Somewhat disappointed with this purchase.

reviews.title: Slower than versions with les storage, apparently
reviews.review_text: I got the 12tb version and it had a top write speed of 42mbs, even using a USB 3.2 port. I have seen reviews that indicate that the 4tb and 6tb versions have wright speeds of up to 170mbs. Looking through the vents of the chassis it appeared that there was a single disk drive. I think that there was a trade off with size and speed.

reviews.title: The unit was manufactured in 2021
reviews.review_text: I ordered a 4 TB memory and expect it to at least have its own software included to install. It didn't, so I went out to the manufacturers website to download software. After I did that I found out instead of having a 4 TB I only had a 4.9 MB, now I have to drive into Walmart and get my money back

reviews.title: Works with my iMac so far
reviews.review_text: I am using this drive as a Time Machine backup device for my iMac. In my case, I formatted the drive to the Apple file system and within minutes after, the drive was creating the first backup on the drive. No issues as of yet. My one complaint is a design flaw by the WD team - a missing power/activity light!!! Get dinged a star for that WD!

reviews.title: 4TB My Book Stops working on iMac
reviews.review_text: Our 4TB My Book worked well for quite awhile on our iMac desktop. Showed no signs or issues until we were no longer able to access the contents. Fortunately I do have most of the files backed up elsewhere, but would be real nice if this one was still accessible. That way I could be sure of having all of my files. Have replaced this drive with a hopefully higher quality professional model. Stinks that it was out of warranty. this was the first time we have had any problem with WD products.

reviews.title: Password safe. Convenient. Trustworthy. Love it.
reviews.review_text: I love these. I have two and they work great. I love that I can safely store thousands of files and trust the password feature. Great for storing important documents, family photos, video game storage etc. Ive never had any issues and Ive been using mine for years. First one I bought almost a decade ago and the second one Ive had for a few months. Very convenient and trustworthy.

reviews.title: MyBook 4TB external hard driver
reviews.review_text: Bought to replace my older (12+ year old) external hard drive. It finally quit.

reviews.title: 8 tb
reviews.review_text: My largest yet. Plug and off we went, just like the others. Good product!

reviews.title: Works Great!
reviews.review_text: Tremendous amount of storage! Great Value

reviews.title: Works As It Should
reviews.review_text: Seems to work as advertised. A bit noisy for a backup drive .
Competitive pricing and delivery was faster than Amazon.

reviews.title: I used this hard drive once, then it stopped worki
reviews.review_text: I used this hard drive once, then it stopped working.

reviews.title: Good Product
reviews.review_text: Good product so far it is working for the time being, WD seems to be good product
Easy install, Acronis software worked fine with all my previous drives.

reviews.title: Lots of storage
reviews.review_text: Great price for such a large capacity external hard drive.

reviews.title: Great brand; great product.
reviews.review_text: Great brand; great product.
Price was cheaper than other retailers, but WD quality is only middling as similar drive has failed.

reviews.title: Solid work horse external hard drive
reviews.review_text: The go to hard drive for me when it comes to external storage. western Digital drives are dependable and proven to last.

reviews.title: Nice.
reviews.review_text: Great and easy! Just backing up files. Found other features confusing and it's all I really need it for anyway.

reviews.title: Dead upon opening.
reviews.review_text: The external drive did not work; tried multiple outlets to confirm it was not a power issue. Packed it back up and returned it.
Walmart site gives a complete description of what to expect from this PS5. It was delivered on time so I could be home to bring it in the house. And the price was a very fair sale price.

reviews.title: This is the EXTERNAL DRIVE you want
reviews.review_text: I have around 30 MY BOOK drives. Still one of the best external drives for the price. Seems slower than older models but acceptable. Never had a problem with ANY My BOOK drives quality wise. ALL still work.

reviews.title: 1 month in, and very happy 👍
reviews.review_text: Bought the 8TB version about a month ago. It made a very slight knocking sound when I first fired it up, but that completely vanished after 15-20 minutes, and it's been quiet since. I ran a full diagnostic, with the included software, just to be sure. I understand that this isn't an SSD, so the speed would not be as fast as my m.2, but I'm still impressed at how quick this little HDD moves. I also love the included software, so you can run the occasional diagnostic scan, and keep your files password protected. I highly recommend this product. 👍

reviews.title: Great external storage/space
reviews.review_text: I've had an external hardrive before for storing videos, pics, music, etc. (vs. cluttering up my desktop's capacity/space) and this one works like the ones before it----perfectly!! Just plug, play, store!! Only purchased this model cause of the increased capacity/space, but no regrets. So far, so good.

reviews.title: Concerning ticking/clicking noises
reviews.review_text: Purchased for a system backup. The form factor is nice, and the options to get pretty large drives is great. But, when I powered mine up, I heard these irregular clicking/ticking noises about 1 to 5 seconds apart. It could be that these are just part of the motor moving the drive arm, but the noises persisted even when I wasn't trying to read or write any files. And they sure sounded like the sort of noises that indicate there's a mechanical problem with the drive itself. I found the noises to be pretty annoying, so I returned the drive and will look elsewhere.

reviews.title: Works perfectly
reviews.review_text: Although my My Book did not come with the easy setup card, I called and was able to get help setting up my new WD Book. I have had my previous WD backup Book for about 10 years, but it was no longer backing up, but definitely got my money's worth on that drive.

reviews.title: Cheap unit but stays warm which may fail soon
reviews.review_text: Typical WD My book that was nicely priced. What was weird was the funky 2 combined connector... Not sure if this is the new standard USB 3 connector but this was the first time that I see this.... I use this as a backup device and it still stay warm even when it is not backing up. The server that I am backing is configured to turn off the usb interface when not in use. I am not sure if My Book power management is working. May need to switch to a NAS backup if the unit fails prematurely from overheating. Another setup issue that I did not like - I needed to format the unit before using. Would have preferred to have the unit pre-formatted.

reviews.title: WD drives work Great
reviews.review_text: At first I was going to plug it into my Pr41pro in the usb slot. That worked good on my local network but found out no play back on plex. So I moved it to my usb port on my router. That worked great for more space. I have always had good luck with WD external hard drives. This one works great. I have seven others for many years.

reviews.title: Saving important documents
reviews.review_text: Great price. I have a 500 gb My book and if I recall I paid $99 for it. The size of this is unbelievable!! Transfering my dad's purple heart, and rescue from his Tokyo Raiders days along with the news articles in the World Telegraph. The originals are deteriorating.

Overall, everything was really good. The only problem is that the WalMart online website very often does not provide enough information about the products they sell. For example, there was no information about what computer operating systems were compatible with this product. I did not discover that information until I opened the product box and read the info sheet. I've encountered this problem with a lot of WalMart online products. This has, on several occasions, prompted me to purchase the product from other stores that provided full information about the product. It would seem to me that it would be easy to include that info if the person uploading the product on the WalMart website simply pretended to be the prospective buyer and asked themselves what info they would need to know before deciding to buy the product. I know there are buyers in the real world that can come up with some strange questions. But most buyers know what info about a product they need.

reviews.title: Pleased with my purchase
reviews.review_text: I'm very pleased with the purchase of My Book Desktop Hard Drive. I was looking for a backup drive so I would not lose my files again after having lost some very important files before the purchase. I have an older laptop so I'm not sure if it's the laptop or the hard drive but it seems that when I leave My Book attached to my laptop the laptop will not complete the startup cycle until I disconnect the external hard drive. I can then reconnect it once it has completed the startup. This makes it difficult to schedule routine backups but I am overall pleased that I actually have an external hard drive with enough space to hold as much info as I will ever put on it.

reviews.title: Satisfied
reviews.review_text: Even with a Mac, a plug and play. Works flawlessly. Second WD drive I have bought. Only reason why I bought it is the first one is older than Moses, and started not working reliably, and it is not supported by WD any longer. I am confident this one too will last a long time with faithful service.

reviews.title: Why i purchased 2- 18 TB WD My Book Ext. drives
reviews.review_text: If you are going to use this device with a Mac, you (may) need to contact WD technical support to guide you through reformatting prior to use. The reformatting process is logical, but can not be installed using the internal Mac disc utilities, you will need to install WD's download and use tech support to help make this a quick and easy process. This device, ( of which i purchased two) an 18TB My Book, will be used here as back up to my 48TB G Raid 4 bay Shuttle. I do not use the cloud for storage and would prefer to house my own back up. My digital life began with an ever increasing number of By Book's in the 1990's, and then migrated everything to G Drive storage. What I have done now, in this purchase is consolidate 12 G drives into, 1 48 TB G 4bay shuttle and 2- 18 TB My Book drives to bring of my storage needs up to date, with space available for adding data for a few years to come. This series of recent purchases represents my continued loyalty and trust in the performance reliability of products from WD for well over two decades.

reviews.title: Good value at Walmart
reviews.review_text: This external hard drive is highly rated and reviewed on the internet when used as a backup device. People who use it for other purposes than backup do not seem to like it. However, for my purposes it is perfect and the Walmart price was the best on the web. I have used WD products for years and always been satisfied. My single complaint is the setup. No instructions in the box, nothing happened when I plugged it in. Thankfully YouTube has some excellent videos on how to setup and by going to the WD website I found the software needed to get the job done; although not all of it is there. WD sent me to the Acronis website for a free download on their software made for the WD hard drive. This is not a process for those who do not have some experience setting up computer equipment. But for those with moderate experience the job was straight forward and I was able to easily backup my computer which is why I bought this hard drive. I recommend as described above.

reviews.title: Driver problems
reviews.review_text: This 4tb WD and a WD 1tb are the only ones out of 8 external hard drive that had any problems loading the drivers. Cheaper unknown brands gave me no problems at start up, except WD brand. I was able to get the drivers to final load on the 1tb but this 4tb only 2 of the 3 drivers would load. I don't know that I can trust it. This is my 1st 4tb. Others are 500gb to 2tb. Only this 4tb requires to be plugged into an outlet to work at all. Won't get its power from laptop. Hadn't realized that but maybe that is just because of being my 1st 4tb. While I'll keep it and see how it works, I hate returning, No more WD brand for me! The deal breaker is the difficulty right from the start with its inability to load the drivers, which not even the cheapest other brands had any problems.

reviews.title: Great buy!
reviews.review_text: I bought it for backing up my laptop. Good price. And I was able to upload all my files/data from Windows 7, 64bit even though the information sheet said it was compatible with only Windows 10 . And only 2 days shipping for free. Great buy. I am going to purchase 2 more so I'll have enough sequential back-up capability.

reviews.title: Works, but missing the activity light
reviews.review_text: It works, but I really miss the activity light on my other external drives that Western Digital used to put on the My Book drives. My other complaint is that the utilities that came with it are not backward compatable with my old My Book drives and made them inoperable.

reviews.title: My Book 8TB (owned 3 wks)
reviews.review_text: Quick shipping. Worked immediately after plugging in. I was concerned that I couldn't use it to backup a system image (windows 10), but discovered that this was because it wasn't formatted with NTFS. After reformatting, it worked fine. I decided to use bitlocker for encryption instead of the WD software, for ease/transparency of use with windows 10. My only small annoyance so far is that the drive seems to spin down after only a few minutes of non-use. This means that accessing it periodically (on the order of minutes) takes more time because it needs to spin up again each time. I bought it to replace a seagate drive which died only shortly out of warranty. I hope this drive shows itself to be more reliable.

reviews.title: Works But Loud
reviews.review_text: My second unit after the first no longer worked with my Apple operating system. Used the first now and then with Time Machine and it worked fine. Haven't used the second yet. Only down side is the noise the second makes sitting on my desk which "microphones" the sound. Had to bungee cord it to a slab of cork and then set the slab on an air cushion to dampen the WD unit's loud vibes.

reviews.title: Too Many Pictures!
reviews.review_text: My desktop says that I have too many pictures cramping my "storage", so I went looking for external storage. Purchased MY BOOK after reading another reviewer with the same storage problem with is pictures. Seems easy enough to use and has plenty of room. 1 Tb should be plenty of room for my pictures and music files!

reviews.title: Damaged
reviews.review_text: When I first hooked this up it had a really bad vibration and was super loud when reading/writing files. Also had like a bad rhythmic vibration that you can hear and feel just by touching my desk it was on. Few days later it stopped showing up in my files. I had to unplug and plug in the power every now and then for it to show up. So now I am re-transferring my data to the old drive and replacing this with another brand.

reviews.title: Easy To Use.
reviews.review_text: Easy to use. Attached to PC running Windows 10 and was quickly detected and added to file system. Been adding 1800+ DVD/Blu-Ray movie collection to the drive and data transfer speed has been quite good. Have only had for a couple of weeks so can't say much about the longevity of the unit. Only time will tell ;-).

reviews.title: Tons of Capacity and Speed!
reviews.review_text: Super Quick! Our biggest Bottleneck was older HDDs thats couldn't handle the throughput. It's a perfect Archive drive or daily backups. We reformatted it though before use which over a day, which is no big deal, but it gave us an extra 800GB of storage which was a major plus for us. But if you are not familiar with formatting don't go doing that. Anyways 10/10 I will get again for more archive files.

reviews.title: Damaged

reviews.title: Problems with the drive I received (12 TB My Book)
reviews.review_text: Unfortunately the drive I received here is a bum. From day one, it made loud grinding noises. My other drives do not make these noises. When I checked the drive, it didn't show errors so I checked the cords with alternatives I knew to be working well. The noise was not consistent so I attempted to load files. The files wouldn't show correctly as if they weren't loading onto the drive. When I closed the folder and reopened, they were there. This is also not normal behavior. I also noticed intermittent behaviors were the drive would load much slower than the rest (including another 12 tb with matching files). Sometimes taking 15-20 minutes (I'd give up on it loading and go do something else only to come back and it's loaded). It has caused disk utility to crash and I haven't had that happen before. DU only crashes or loads very slowly when this drive is connected. Sometimes the drive doesn't connect at all. I reached out for support but will likely have to exchange under warranty. I feel there is something not right and I have numerous WD EHD's, this one is not behaving normally. I have a concern of being forced into a refurbished option but my drive is only 2.5 months old and has had this problem since day one. I wish I'd gone with my gut for the exchange before the first 30 days. I am also concerned I will now have additional shipping costs despite that this drive was sent to me like this.

reviews.title: FAKE DRIVES - Do Not Purchase!!!

The reason I say this is more a review of walmart is that as soon as I got home I noticed the plastic stickers on the box that seal it were cut. Opened it anyway and the cords didn't have any sort of twist tie holding them neatly together, so I have to assume this was bought and returned and no one bothered to check it, they just put it back on the shelf. I wouldn't normally buy a hard drive from walmart, but I was in a rush and best buy didn't have any 8TD models and microcenter wanted way more for them and is a farther drive for me. But, this one is definitely going back. Make sure you check the packaging before you buy/leave the store. My fault for not doing that.

reviews.title: Watch out for drive swaps!!!
reviews.review_text: I went to my local Walmart yesterday and bought 2 of these 8TB drives to shuck for my NAS (remove the drive from the enclosure to install into a computer). The first drive opened with no problem and it had a white label 8TB drive inside. Installed in NAS and works beautifully. The second drive, however, would not open. One side was stuck and wouldn't budge. Since I had no plan to use the enclosure and only wanted the drive inside, I went ahead and used a screwdriver to forcibly crack open the enclosure to get to the drive. I was shocked/angered to see that it had a 320GB drive inside, not the 8TB drive it should have. Someone took out the 8TB drive and replaced it with a cheap 320GB drive. How it ended up back in the case with the others, available to sell with 2 uncut security labels I had to cut to open the box is beyond me. It almost makes me think it was an employee that did it. They had also glued one side of the enclosure tray which is why I couldn't open it. I was able to get a refund, but just wanted to give everyone a heads up that people are doing this and that even though the case appears to be new and unopened, that may not be the case.

Minuses: USB 3.0 limits the transfer speed of this drive to roughly 36 MB/sec. So if you have a lot of GB, or even a TB of two of data to transfer over, it will take awhile.

reviews.title: HD and Power Supply Too Awkward for Desk
reviews.review_text: The Hard Drive was too large for my desk and the power supply was awkward. I bought the WD easystore instead because it is smaller and does not require a power supply.

reviews.title: Works flawless for me
reviews.review_text: If you need a simple home server for streaming media files and sharing documents between users in a home network, this is just perfect. I know that there are more features such as accessing de server from the Internet but I do not need these. I use the Twonkey DLNA server which works very well with our smart TV. We are on Linux and 2 PC's are mounting this home server as an external drive for maintenance and archiving. I also like the energy saving feature which spins down the drive after some idle time. This saves energy and is preventing wearing out equipment. As I never had any problem at all I can recommend this for simple home server use.

reviews.title: A little big
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This drive while running was pretty quiet. I needed a lot of extra space on my computer as I do music and it is a great on my mac. I can continue to produce and store more things and it’ll still take a long time to fill up

reviews.title: Good drive. Not so good connection
reviews.review_text: They tell you on the website that it is not recommended to use a hub to connect the drive. Well guess what? MacBook Pro has NO USB-A PORTS! So what to do... what to do... Buy a Micro USB to USB C cable. And violà!!! It works and seems even faster than the inferior cable they provide. Shame on you WD! You should provide that with your drive. Or reimburse me. LOL

reviews.title: 12 Tb version slow, 42 MB/s with USB 3.2
reviews.review_text: I saw a review for the 4 Tb version that showed test results of 170 MB/s. That was a buying point for me, but when I bought the 12 Tb version I am getting a top write speed of 42 MB/s even with USB 3.2 port. That is actually slower than my old portable hard drive.

reviews.title: Reliable, not quiet, sleep timer not working
reviews.review_text: I've been using the 8TB version for about two years. Seems very reliable, and no issues with it. The only problem, and for me a major issue, is thta the sleep timer doesn't not work. I configured the timer to 30 minutes using the WD Drive utilities app, and it ignores the setting.

reviews.title: WOW
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This gadget can do it all store files,video,my pictures, That’s way it’s call a book keep all your keepsake safe, I getting ready to install it in my laptop, technology is so amazing and I just blown away don’t have to keep my photos on laptop any came fast and if you having technical problems setting up there is a 1800 number you can’t go wrong I letting my families & friends no stop storing your files Pictures, Videos on your computer, I am truly loving the Book, All I can say is WOW!!!!!!

reviews.title: Stopped working under 3 years
reviews.review_text: Reading the reviews, I seem to have a similar experience as Samantha. My WD 4TB Book has simply stopped backing up. Because it is loud, I can hear it go on and off, mainly staying off. Tried to triage, but nothing as worked. Although this is under three years, when I check my profile online, it says out of warranty, even though I had it registered. It was easy to use and worked well ... when it worked. But to only last less than three years is not ideal.

reviews.title: Great External Hard drive..!!
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these. I have two and they work great. I love that I can safely store thousands of files and trust the password feature. Great for storing important documents, family photos, video game storage etc. I have already been letting my friends know that this is the best quality product if you want to free up space. Great Product!

reviews.title: Easy to Transfer
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the size of the WD it wasn't that big or heavy so easy to store in my room. The product was easy to set up and to install to my computer. Transferring file from my computer to the WD was quick and easy. Having 4TB was great can save more photos, pictures and movies.

reviews.title: Compact and portable
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I desperately needed something to hold the thousands of photos and videos of my family on my computer and needed expanded storage to do so and so this was the perfect choice. Let me say first off that I love how sleek and compact this drive is, taking very minimal space on my desk. The USB plugs right into my desktop and it comes with easy installation software that is super easy to follow. The portable storage allows up to 4TB of expanded storage capability. You can feel safe with all your photos, videos, and files with its security and password protection. There is software utilities as well to help you manage it all. The backup protection helps me feel more secure with a lifetime of family memories that are priceless to me. This is a great addition to your desktop that uses minimal space.

reviews.title: Reliable as a Camry
reviews.review_text: I just wanted to drop a note about the Western Digital MyBook 4 TB drive. I'm going to purchase a new MyBook, even though my 13 yr old one is still going strong. The drive has backed up our old PC and our IMac. I have never had any issues with this drive. It does what it's supposed to do. It sits next to the IMac, quietly backing up our data. I looked at other brands, but Western Digital did not let us down. I will stick with the brand. I hope the new one lasts just as long!

reviews.title: Best Investment for Peace of Mind
reviews.review_text: I purchased this external drive for backups of important files, documents, videos, music, and programs in April 2020. It's now June 2024 and it's working fine. I have been copying files to and from this drive every day for 4 years and I am very pleased with its performance. I have used it several times to recover my system. If and when it ever fails, I will buy another. This is the best investment for peace of mind.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this because my son is a big time gamer and everytime he downloads new game to xbox one, he would have to uninstall one. He hooked this to the xbox and it picked it up right away and he is so happy with it.

reviews.title: Great for needing additional space
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am a YouTube who uses a MacBook as means of uploading my videos. I would often be faced with the problem of my Mac running out of space and having to factory reset it to get it to run properly again. This product has provided me with the ability to store necessary files on it so I no longer use up all the space on my MacBook! I love this product, it is easy to use, light weight, and super convenient.

reviews.title: sucks

reviews.title: Perfect for saving photos etc.
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I take so many photos almost every day, that I don't want to store it on my actual desktop computer. I needed a removable hard drive to be able to save my photos and keep them safe. This Western Digital 4TB removable hard drive "My Book", has been so easy to use. Every week or so, I make a point to upload them and transfer to this hard drive. Once all is transferred, I eject it and keep it disconnected from my computer in case a virus should attack it. This happened once before and I lost everything. I vowed to never let that happen again. This hard drive has massive space and the transfer is quick and easy. I would absolutely recommend.

reviews.title: Yesss
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Yesssss! I was actually looking for something exactly like this! Slim, compact, lots of memory and sleek so it doesn’t interfere or clash with my home decor… welp I found it! Love this book desktop! Exactly what I needed

My only problem is that I have so many ways to use this I do not know what to store first. But I take a lot of photographs and this will be wonderful to store them in and the size is just right.

It is a fairly compact size p, so it will not be taking up a lot of space when in use. Design wise it is very sleek and just looks very appealin.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.review_text: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The WD 4TB My Book Is great. It was very easy to set up and use. It is amazing to be able to back up all my pictures and important files and know that they are safe. Thank you for this amazing product.

reviews.title: Securing files
reviews.review_text: I needed to secure my files as I had seen indications someone was trying to hack my files on my computer through the browser, trying to load files on my browser, which I stopped continually, as they were crashing my browser continually. I was trying to load my files to the publisher. And someone had changed my firewall setting. And someone had turned on the remote desktop at one point somehow. I had no idea how they did that. A file folder of my writing project book had been ruined by some attempt to link to those files. I needed to secure my files as I am readying to move to my new HP i7 with Windows 10. The drive will secure my files, along with some other offline storage for security. The 4T size provides room to organize my folders between my Windows 7 and Windows 10. Windows 7 has no more security updates after the end of year 2019, or early January 2020.

reviews.title: Not a bad HDD
reviews.review_text: So far seems pretty legit. Love the fact that it works on PlayStation 5. A little disappointed that it's not really 4TB. More like 3.7 but close enough right? Anyway overall seems to be a pretty good HDD. Holds quite a bit. Somewhat fast. Overall a 4 out of 5

Had to go to the local store to bail myself. Called customer servce, on hold for 33 minutes before I just hung up. Never aga ok n!!!

reviews.title: great product for gamers and pictures/family stuff
reviews.review_text: this product is great i got two of them one for my xbox and another for my computer it hold all my family pictures and then for my xbox it stores all my games and there even ready to play so definitely worth the money my son even got one for himself unfortunately we found out it doesn't ready play with the newer xbox games but it still stores your games and then you can still play older games

reviews.title: External hard drive used for laptop backup
reviews.review_text: Well made, but too difficult to format for MAC. Returned it and bought The Passport 4TB external drive made for MAC instead, which is an excellent item and very easy to use. Plug it in and there you go, no trouble at all, as this one is made expressly for Apple.

reviews.title: Beware of WD Products! had issues with 3 different
reviews.review_text: What is the deal with WD products, currently I am having issues with 3 different of their products at once??!! My WDBFJK004OHBK My WD My Book hard drive is not working correctly, I was in the middle of downloading some files and shut my computer down to run errands and when I came back to finish the files my My Book was no longer showing up in my file explorer, it does show up under the section where it says eject item, it shows up in the drives manager but not the other manager. The hard drive is running, and light shows from the inside.( I ran the WD digital Data Life guard Diagnostics Tool and it shows the my book but says not available)As I said it was working perfectly and my errands took less than 30 minutes when it stopped showing in the file explorer anymore. The more I look into wd hard drives the more I find that thier products have a lot of issues that I did not know about when I looked into the research originally. I tried everything that was suggested. I plugged the hardrive directly into the wall, I shut down the computer a couple of times, I went in and unistalled the my book drive under all the areas you could do that and reinstalled nothing worked!!! this is ridulous how can their products have so many issues this one does not make sense. it was working and than it wasnt and I can not get to my files that I was back up which is the whole point of these products how is wd sitll in business seriously!? Issue 2 I plugged in my passport 2tb external hard drive that was working perfectly and has thousands of vids and other files on it into my WD live Media player to watch something off it and it played for a second (3 issues) but the purple screen that often happens with the WD media showed up again the files played fine but when I was done unplugging the hdmi cable it would not show the files on the screen anymore and now when I plug the passport in my computer to check it it will not show up on my File explorer or the drive file at all now!! This is Crap WD all of this has happened in just the past 3 days in the middle of another Covid shutdown, again how is this company still in business I now have several thousand files, and movies and things that I can now now find or retrieve or whatever!!!?? and these were my backups I only have some of what was on my My Book hardrive that is back uped on another hardrive but some of the best stuff was on this passport that suddenly stopped working or something??!Q!

reviews.title: Unstable. Needs external shock absorber
reviews.review_text: Fast and easily connected. Serious problem: easily knocked over when standing vertically. There should be vents on the sides too. The drive should come with an external shock absorber las in the Rugged series.

reviews.title: Will Not Work With Windows 11
reviews.review_text: Purchase My Book 4tb on 10/22/2021. Worked well. On 11/22/2021, I purchased a new desktop with Windows 11. WD Software would not work with Windows 11.

reviews.title: Failed right out of the Box.
reviews.review_text: Brand New out of the Box and FAILED to work at all! I have another just like it that I've had for 2 months and so far, it's working for now. 50% Fail rate is only worth 1 star!

reviews.title: Works as expected
reviews.review_text: Great customer service from WD.Called for help to set up back up.Sent me link to set up file history back up in windows 10.Agents spent a lot of time helping me.

reviews.title: Best price and fast service
reviews.review_text: Needed a new backup device and after alot of research decided on the WD My Book. Was delighted when I found it at the best price at my local Walmart. I used the order online and pick=up at store option and it couldn't have been easier.

reviews.title: Pro's and con's.
reviews.review_text: Great for storing pictures, documents and music. However, video playback is slow and often pauses. You can store movies, etc., but to watch them you will have to move them back to the PC.

reviews.title: Good value , a little slow
reviews.review_text: Perfect compliment to my 12 year and 8 year old Mybook (12 year old 1tb and 8 year old 3 Tb )external drives. Drive transfer is slow ~22MB/sec from internal hard drive to WD.

reviews.title: Very disappointed with My Book
reviews.review_text: This My Book was not "plug and play". Once out of the box, it took me about 30 minutes to get it to appear in Desk Utility, which made me suspicious, but I went ahead and began saving my files to it. I ejected it but have now spent several days trying to get it to reappear in Desk Utility which I have not been able to do. So basically all my files are on an external hard drive that I can't open to delete the files so I can return it. Don't buy this. There's nothing convenient or efficient about it.

reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
reviews.review_text: Yes the negative reviews are correct, DO NOT BUY. I used it twice, and when trying to access my data, the thing isnt working. It doesnt open in my computer, it doesnt allow me to do anything nor access my data, now I have to go pay a third party company to recover my data.

reviews.title: Kaput after 6 mos.
reviews.review_text: Stopped working after 6 months. At least my previous WD My Book managed to last 2 months over the warranty. Really sucks to lose data. Apparently WD builds these cheaply so there are less backup mechanisms and you're more prone to get your data wiped. I'm done with WD, sticking with Toshiba they have yet to fail me.

reviews.title: MyBook is Totally Amazing
reviews.review_text: I was amazed at how fast MyBook got to work without formatting, Oh I did make a lot of folders but the primary ones only totaled three. I like the drive better than the Seagate drives available. I would recommend anyone to add-on storage space via USB, its so simple and now there's a 3.1 version which is above this 3.0 USB.
Perfect for backing up my files. Simple to set up, easy to use
